Topic.Title: Various Squiffy issues are now fixed

Posts.EditableText:
I have fixed various issues that have caused the web version of Squiffy to be completely broken for some time.

Things should now be fully functioning again:

- Running, Downloading, Previewing and Publishing games from the online editor now works
- Interactive examples and the ScratchPad in the Squiffy documentation now work again
- A long-standing issue where sometimes the online editor would load an existing game as blank is now fixed (if you're still seeing this, clear your browser's Local Storage for `textadventures.co.uk` and refresh)

Note:
- You will currently still see an error message when publishing a game, though the publish will have succeeded in the background (you'll be able to find your published game listing on your [My Games](https://textadventures.co.uk/create) page)

I am aware that various other things on textadventures.co.uk are broken, like registering an account, resetting your password etc. I am hoping to help the maintainers fix those too.

Longer term I'll be setting up a separate website for Squiffy, and I'm planning to release a new version as a Progressive Web App. Stay tuned!

tips for making a strong password

Length: Aim for at least 12-16 characters
Complexity: Use a mix of upper and lower case letters, numbers, and special characters
Avoid Predictable Patterns: Don’t use easily guessable information like birthdays, names, or common words
